meanings.definition: A small boat, often carried or towed by a larger vessel.
meanings.sent1: The dingey bobbed gently in the water next to the big ship.
meanings.sent2: The sailors used the dingey to reach the shore from the main boat.
meanings.sent3: The captain joked that the dingey was so small, it could fit in his pocket!
meanings.sent4: The dingey was like a loyal companion, always following the larger vessel.
meanings.sent5: The bright red dingey stood out against the vast ocean, a tiny speck of color.

meanings.sent1: The dingey old couch in the corner needed a good cleaning.
meanings.sent2: She refused to wear the dingey old sweater to the party.
meanings.sent3: Despite its dingey look, the old car still ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The dingey room was transformed into a cozy space with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent5: The dingey alley was a stark contrast to the clean streets of the city.
